channel.description: RedHat (RHEL9) Graphical Environment and Filesystem Wayland - Linux Graphical Environment in RHEL Redhat runs a graphical environment called Wayland. This is the foundation for running GUI apps. Wayland is a client/server display protocol. Which just means that the user (the client) requests a resource and the display manager (the server) serves those resources. Wayland is slowly replaced and older display protocol called “X”. And has better graphics capabilities, features, and performance than X.
